content.problem: Compiling 20-year-old C++ is impossible due to lost dependencies and deprecated toolchains.
content.approach: Lift binaries to LLVM IR and re-target to modern architectures (x86-64, ARM, WASM).
content.why_not_bullshit: Binary lifting technology (McSema, Remill) has matured significantly. LLVM provides stable IR format.

content.problem: SQLite is great but doesn't replicate. CRDTs enable conflict-free sync for local-first apps.
content.approach: Wrap SQLite in a CRDT layer using automerge or yjs principles for state management.
content.why_not_bullshit: SQLite's deterministic query planner + CRDT merge semantics are compatible. Prior art: ElectricSQL, CR-SQLite.

content.problem: AI models require massive VRAM and modern GPUs, excluding billions of users.
content.approach: Aggressive 2-bit quantization + AVX2-optimized matrix math for older hardware.
content.why_not_bullshit: Low-bit quantization preserves 90% of reasoning capabilities with 1/10th memory. AVX2 available since 2013.

content.problem: Silicon scaling is hitting physical limits; biological computing is highly parallel.
content.approach: A language that compiles high-level logic into CRISPR-Cas9 sequence instructions.
content.why_not_bullshit: DNA strands can act as logic gates through strand displacement techniques (Qian & Winfree, 2011).

content.problem: Standard CFS schedulers fail to predict bursty microservices workloads, causing tail latency spikes.
content.approach: Replace heuristic scoring with a lightweight LSTM trained on task switch patterns.
content.why_not_bullshit: In-kernel inference is now possible with fixed-point math and specialized registers (AVX-512).

content.problem: Centralized CDNs are expensive and single points of failure.
content.approach: Blockchain-backed reward system for browsers sharing static assets via WebRTC.
content.why_not_bullshit: WebRTC DataChannels have sufficient bandwidth for regional asset sharing. Browser storage API enables caching.

content.problem: CSS is full of runtime errors and silent failures (typos, invalid units, broken cascades).
content.approach: Procedural macros that parse CSS at compile-time and generate type-safe Rust structs.
content.why_not_bullshit: Rust proc macros can validate CSS syntax and unit types during build. Prior art: styled-components, emotion.

title: Mobile Gaming Optimizer for Weak Hardware

content.problem: Mobile games on low-end devices suffer from high CPU load and frame drops.
content.approach: Semantic collision convergence: reduce collision checks by 95% using spatial hashing + predictive physics.
content.why_not_bullshit: Early tests show 40ms â†’ 4ms collision time on Galaxy A10. Physics engine determinism preserved.

content.problem: Rust compile times kill the feedback loop during UI development (30s+ per iteration).
content.approach: Dynamic library swapping with a state-preserving bridge between host and guest using #[repr(C)].
content.why_not_bullshit: ABI stability can be mimicked with repr(C) for shared state types. Existing: hot-lib-reloader crate.
